ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a greater grasp on the German language. My knowledge of grammar, vocabulary and history increased substantially.

Developed skills in becoming conversational in German with a focus on explaining opinions/points of view, telling stories, and talking about locations in longer form discussions. Learned some grammar, mostly for uncommon use cases, and drilled more common grammar.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: None. This course was great all things considered.

Because the course is accelerated, you spend about 3 hours a day working in German, so you very quickly get better at being conversational and thinking in German rather than translating, more so than I feel you would doing that same amount of work over a full semester. The location based chapters felt a bit strange at times, especially since it often felt like a secondary topic, rather than studying something in German.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I absolutely would without hesitation. Great professor, great language and solid course

I think the summer version of this course was great, although I'm sure it will look different in future years since it is normally a study abroad course. That being said, if it is offered again as an accelerated online summer course I would definitely recommend it.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
